abstract: A settlement would probably require Swiss banks to pay fines totaling more than a billion dollars.
snippet: A settlement would probably require Swiss banks to pay fines totaling more than a billion dollars.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 7:38 p.m. |  Switzerland and the United States are close to announcing an agreement to end their long dispute over how to punish banks that helped Americans evade taxes, banking and government officials said on Wednesday.

headline.main: U.S. and Switzerland Are Close to Deal on Penalizing Banks in Tax Case
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Switzerland Are Close to Deal on Penalizing Banks in Tax Case

byline.original: By David Jolly and Lynnley Browning
